com.ragego.engine

Class GameBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ragego.engine.GameBoard

  • public class GameBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    Represent a board of Go.

    On this board, intersections are represented with numerical coordinates :

    • The first coordinate is the column from left to right.
    • The second coordinate is the line from top to bottom.

    Each intersection is assigned to a shape, empty (or assigned to something special)

    First player has black color and the second is white.

        secondPlayer - The second player (conventional white stone player)

                 Player secondPlayer,
                 int boardSize)

        secondPlayer - The second player (conventional white stone player)

    • Method Detail

      • nextMove

        public void nextMove()
        Play a new move. Apply the Rule 7 to make a new move.

      • canPlay

        public boolean canPlay(GameNode node)
                throws GoRuleViolation
        Check that we can play on this intersection.
        Parameters:
        node - The GameNode which represent what you want to play.
        Returns:
        true if it's correct following the Go rules to play on this row.
        Throws:
        GoRuleViolation - If rules are not respected.

      • play

        public void play(GameNode node)
        Play a node on this board. This method act a node on this board.
        Actions performed:
        1. Assigns this board to the node
        2. Checks if action is not violating Go rules (throws IllegalArgumentException if not).
        3. Sets lastNode as parent
        4. Prevents listeners
        5. Act the action
        6. Recompute hash for the node and lock the node
        Parameters:
        node - The action to play

        public int getBoardSize()
        Retrieve the size of this board.
        Returns:
        The number of column and lines on board

      • getRepresentation

        public int[][] getRepresentation()
        Create a primitive-type representation of the game. First index is for line, second is for column
        Returns:
        A table where : 0 is an empty row, 1 for first player, 2 for second

      • getOpponent

        public Player getOpponent(Player player)
        Get the other player that one. This function is useful when you use the opponent
        Parameters:
        player - The player for who we look for opponent
        Returns:
        The opponent player (null if there is not)

        Parameters:
        intersection - The intersection to test
        Returns:
        true if it's on board.

      • getBoardHash

        public java.lang.String getBoardHash()
        Get a string of the board state. Compute a string which is unique in function of board stones positions.
        Returns:
        A unique hash for the current board situation

      • getStoneGroups

        public java.util.ArrayList<StoneGroup> getStoneGroups()
        Retrieve Shapes from this board.
        Returns:
        array of stoneGroups

      • getBlackPlayer

        public Player getBlackPlayer()
        Get the black player. In Go rules, the black player start the game so this function is an easy way to access to first player.
        Returns:
        The first player
        See Also:
        getFirstPlayer()

      • getWhitePlayer

        public Player getWhitePlayer()
        Get the white player. In Go rules, the white player do not start the game so this function is an easy way to access to second player.
        Returns:
        The second player
        See Also:
        getSecondPlayer()

      • getLastNode

        public GameNode getLastNode()

      • copyBoard

        public GameBoard copyBoard()
        Create a complete copy of this GameBoard. A copy is a heavy action because it will copy all stoneGroups and stones (do it with cautious).
        Data which is copied :
        • StoneGroups: see StoneGroup.copy(GameBoard)
        • Stones: see Stone.copy(GameBoard)
        • Nodes: see GameNode.copy(GameBoard)
        Listeners are not copied to not call on fake events (but you can copy them).
        Returns:
        A board with copied data.

      • getScoreCounter

        public ScoreCounter getScoreCounter()
        Get ScoreCounter attached to this board
        Returns:
        The ScoreCounter

      • getLetterForPlayer

        public char getLetterForPlayer(Player player)
        Get letter that represent for player. W is for White player and B is for Black player.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to get the letter
        Returns:
        The letter capitalized

      • ia_getBoard

        public java.util.HashMap<Intersection,Stone> ia_getBoard()
        Get the board.
        Returns:
        The hash map currently in use by this board to store stones

      • ia_createStoneAndComputeDead

        public Stone ia_createStoneAndComputeDead(Intersection intersection,
                                          Player player)
        Create a stone and compute dead stones. Put a stone on intersection and compute dead stones. If there is already a stone, it deletes it and creates a new one.
        Parameters:
        intersection - Where to place the stone.
        player - The player who owns the stone.
        Returns:
        The new stone

      • ia_createStone

        public Stone ia_createStone(Intersection intersection,
                            Player player)
        Create a stone. Put a stone on intersection and wait end of turn before compute dead stones. If there is already a stone, it deletes it and creates a new one.
        Parameters:
        intersection - Where to place the stone.
        player - The player who owns the stone.
        Returns:
        The new stone

      • ia_deleteStone

        public void ia_deleteStone(Stone stone)
        Delete a stone. Delete a stone from the board without any side effects.
        Parameters:
        stone - The stone to delete.

      • ia_moveStone

        public Stone ia_moveStone(Stone stone,
                          Intersection intersection)
        Move a stone. This move a stone to a new location. If there is already a stone, it does nothing.
        Parameters:
        stone - The stone to move
        intersection - The new intersection
        Returns:
        The new Stone moved to the position or the old if it was not possible
